summary: The document is a declassified record associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, focusing on an individual named HIDALGO. HIDALGO, a GS-11 level employee in the 4H Division, had a notable past with the Communist Party from August 1946 to May 1949 before becoming a government witness in the trial of the Eleven CP Leaders. In 1952, he was granted a covert security clearance for operations in Latin America as a contract agent. Additionally, the document notes his medical status in early March 1962 and mentions his mother's covert security approval for a contract-clerical role.
key_findings: HIDALGO was a GS-11 employee in the 4H Division with a history in the Communist Party and later as a government witness.
He received a covert security clearance in 1952 for Latin American operations.
The document includes details about HIDALGO's medical status and his mother's covert security approval for clerical work.
